html:
How Many Times Can You Turn 40?

Tom McMillen turns 40 a lot.

D.C. National Guard, Grassroots Activists Honored by Citizen Group

Military installations in the District—Ft. McNair, Bowling Air Force Base, the Navy Yard, Coast Guard headquarters and the D.C.
Georgetown Tasted

There's the Rub

Can you pass the Yakimi Orchard Yuzu Kosho?Doesn't quite roll off your tongue, but it's the hottest new Japanese condiment with "citrusy yuzu zest, chile peppers, sea salt and kombu (dried kelp)."

Love & Music at Chuck Brown's Going-Away Party

The celebration of the life and music of DC Go-Go Godfather Chuck Brown stirred to the heights of the Washington Convention Center Thursday afternoon as family members and thousands of fans sang and swayed in memoriam.

A Rarity For Sale in Sheridan-Kalorama's Historic Neighborhood

Guests should be star-struck when they step into this home – a modern dazzler with a woman’s architectural touch now on the market at 2319 Bancroft Place NW. As Washingtonians know, Bancroft Place is one of the most prestigious, sought-after streets in Kalorama.

Beth Cartland's New Show Opens June 8th at Susan Calloway

Colorfully bold, abstract works in oil and mixed media, Beth Cartland's latest exhibition, The Shape of Color II, reflect the spontaneity and masterful techniques of the artist. Openeing reception is June 8 from 6:00 to 8:00 Pm at Susan Calloway Fine Arts. The show runs through July 7, 2012.

Mayor Says Agreement Close on GU Campus Plan

Mayor Vincent Gray strongly suggested on Wednesday evening that agreement has been reached between the community and Georgetown Univesity over the GU plan that will guide its expansion over the next 10 years.
Bye Bye Betsey with Boomerang Tours

Gentlemen, Start Your Engines!

... and ladies, too. But before you do, make sure everything's in working order.

Mention The Georgetown Dish for a FREE check engine light diagnosis/general check over with MOST engine oil and filter change service.
Celebrate Summer with Morton's June 8th

Georgetown Citizens Group to Hand Out Service Awards

By Deirdre BannonCurrent Staff Writer

D.C. Mayor Vincent Gray and Ward 2 Council member Jack Evans will honor four local residents for their service to the Georgetown neighborhood during a ceremony tonight hosted by the Dumbarton House.

Who Will be D.C.'s Next Mayor?

We’ve got a while to go before anyone even declares any interest in running in 2014, but with all the recent press about how Mayor Vincent Gray got elected, with two aides admitting to secret payoffs, and a possible off-the-books “shadow campaign,” some voters are joining
The River

Wisconsin Avenue Farmers’ Market Opens Busiest Season Ever

The Social Safeway never closes. However, with the arrival of spring, shoppers on Wisconsin Avenue have another choice for local produce and foods and a host of outdoor activities.

Georgetown's Water Park

Not a days goes by since it opened that swimsuit-clad toddlers and small children aren't gleefully racing under the fountains at the corner of Wisconsin Avenue and Water Street.

Summer Staples

All set for summer?! It's officially here and that means humid days, sticky metro rides and appreciating your AC when you arrive home from work.
Spirit of '45 Honors WWII Generation on Memorial Day
JACK SPADE Coal Bags

Peacock Café Hosts Mad Men Dinner

Madison Avenue came to Georgetown Wednesday evening.

CNN Features Rose Park Farmers Market

When CNN asked me to talk to them about why farmers markets are important, I knew just the place to film: our own Rose Park Farmers Market.

Help the Homeless Taste of Georgetown VIP Lounge June 2nd

Stop by the VIP Lounge at the Georgetown Ministry Center Saturday, June 2, 2102 from 10:30 am to 12:00 pm. It's the first Fannie Mae Help the Homeless event of the year at the Taste of Georgetown.

Meet Barre3's June Challenge

You know the place ... where ballet meets yoga and pilates.

Taste of Georgetown June 2nd

Thirty of the city’s finest restaurants will be featured at the 19th Annual Taste of Georgetown.

City to Request Jelleff Operating Bids

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

Saving Georgetown's Valley of Eden: Part 2

Who more eloquently than Robert Frost can remind us of the magic of rural nature? To a group paying tribute to Henry David Thoreau 50 years ago this month, the quintessential American poet said this.

Summer Hope: Spot It, Shop It, Support St. Jude!

That's right, Summer Hope is almost here, an evening of fashion and giving back in the heart of Georgetown, where you can Spot It, Shop It, and Support St. Jude Children's Research Hospital!

Papa-Razzi Closes Its Doors

Georgeotwn’s Papa-Razzi restaurant (the chain has 10 other U.S. locations) has closed its doors. Monday afternoon, employees were seen on the sidewalk in front of the entrance at 1064-66 Wisconsin Avenue.

Meet IPSA's New Rock Star Stylist

With his million dollar smile and twinkle in his eye, Anthony Alvarez greets every client with the same enthusiasm. Here at IPSA for three months now, this Texas native has been styling some of Washington's most stylish locks for six years.

Size Matters: A Delightful Discovery at La Madeleine

What a surprising respite! I was delighted Saturday morning, after my three mile walk to Memorial Bridge and back, to find La Madeleine open at 7:00 am.

Have You Seen the SKIN IS IN Buses?

Launched last September by world-renowned dermatologist (and Georgetowner), Dr. Tina Alster's new new line of skin care, SKIN IS IN has been getting lots of national buzz, and now can be seen everywhere around the city ... on buses!

Hobnobbing Trumps All At UDC Schmoozarama

Neither the speeches, nor the food nor anything else seemed to matter as much at the University of the District of Columbia’s gala as rekindling relationships whose roots of friendship ran deep into years past.

The Georgetown Dish Seeks Marketing and Social Media Director

The Georgetown Dish, a leading daily news and social media site focused on Washington's most famous neighborhood, seeks Georgetown-based writer/marketing professional to join The Georgetown Dish team.

Georgetown's a Buzz over Macaron Bee

Move over cupcake, there's a new confection in town.

"The Exorcist" Author Upset over Sibelius' Georgetown University Invitation

For "The Exorcist" author and former Georgetown University student, William Peter Blatty, inviting Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius to speak at his alma mater was too much.

France's First Lady Comes to Cafe Milano

Looking elegant in a grey suit, France’s new first lady, Valérie Trierweiler, had lunch Friday in Cafe Milano’s outdoor patio with the French ambassador’s wife Sophie L’Helias Dalattre.

Intermix Replacing Thos. Moser in Cady's Alley

Sweet Long Red Peppers

D.C. Councilmember Orange Introduces Bill to Expand Opportunities for Local Businesses

Tuesday, Councilmember Vincent B. Orange, Sr. introduced the “Small, Local and Disadvantaged Business Enterprise Development and Assistance Omnibus Amendment Act of 2012.”

Rose Park Featured in Nats Commercial

A promo for a Washington Nationals commercial, shot Thursday morning in Rose Park was filmed by the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network (MASN) for the regional network channel. It will air in two weeks on the MASN sports network channel.

Georgetown DMV Office Closes Saturday, May 19th

Due to construction at the Georgetown Park Mall, the D.C. Department of Motor Vehicle (DMV) Service Center located at 3222 M Street will close on Saturday, May 19, 2012 at 4:00 pm.
Building a Better Fiber Network in Georgetown

Taste Strawberry Granita at the C.H.O.P. Farmer's Market Friday

Visit this Friday, May 18th at the Capital Harvest on the Plaza Farmers Market (13th & Pennsylvania Ave, N.W.) noon to 2:00 pm for a free sample of one of the most popular recipes at the market: Strawberry Granita!

Meet Artist Brian Petro at Vastu This Weekend

On May 19th and 20th, local artist Brian Petro will open the doors to his basement studio at Vastu (1829 14th Street, NW) to host guests for a preview of his work.
The Other Greenbrier
Robin Sutliff's Fleurafoto Show at Baked & Wired

Chef Mike Isabella Opens Bandolero in Georgetown May 24th

Like his first and wildly popular Graffiato in Chinatown, Mike Isabella’s Bandolero is a small-plates concept restaurant, only this time, it's Mexican.

New Owner Takes Reins at Beloved Scheele’s Market

By Deirdre BannonCurrent Staff Writer

Top Dogs of Georgetown Meet at Montrose Park May 19th

This Saturday, May 19th, drag your owners to Montrose Park to meet Karen Taylor of Top Dogs of Georgetown, a new dog walking and sitting company specializing in caring for dogs who live here.

The Diorissimo

Announcing: The Diorissimo. Dior's latest "it" bag and one you'll be sure to covet.
